definition: The word "eloquent" refers to the ability to express oneself fluently and persuasively, often through the use of articulate and well-structured language. It is commonly used to describe individuals who possess a remarkable skill in public speaking or writing, enabling them to convey their thoughts and ideas with great clarity and effectiveness.

examples.german: Sie hat eine eloquente Art zu schreiben.
examples.english: She has an eloquent way of writing.

examples.german: Seine eloquente Argumentation hat mich überzeugt.
Die eloquente Präsentation beeindruckte das Publikum.
examples.english: The eloquent presentation impressed the audience.

examples.german: Er ist ein eloquenter Vertreter seiner Meinung.
examples.english: He is an eloquent advocate for his opinion.
